alert.note: Alert for Coastal Cumberland; Coastal Waldo; Coastal York; Knox; Lincoln; Sagadahoc (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued June 05 at 3:07PM EDT until June 05 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Please check with state and local authorities regarding guidelines for allowed activities. The warm air temperatures today in the upper 60s to lower 70s may cause people to underestimate the dangers of the cold water temperatures, which are currently only in the lower 50s. * WHERE...In New Hampshire, Coastal Rockingham County. In Maine, Coastal Waldo, Coastal Cumberland, Sagadahoc, Lincoln, Knox and Coastal York Counties. * WHEN...Until 5 PM EDT this afternoon. * IMPACTS...The cold water temperatures can quickly cause hypothermia to anyone immersed in the water. When the water temperature is below 60 degrees, the average submerged person could lose dexterity within minutes and be unable to accomplish simple tasks. Anyone on boats or paddlecraft should use extreme caution to avoid this threat.
info.instruction: A Beach Hazards Statement is issued on days when a significant number of boats and paddlecraft are expected to be out on the water and when warm air temperatures may cause people to underestimate the danger of the cold water. Paddle smart from the start. Always wear your life jacket. Be aware of wind conditions, tides, and localized currents.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Cumberland; Coastal Waldo; Coastal York; Knox; Lincoln; Sagadahoc
